articles.headline: 10 Electric Vehicles to Watch
articles.snippet: Sales doubled in 2019, but the industry’s tipping point — severing ties to the gas pump — still lies ahead. These cars will help make that happen.
articles.abstract: Sales doubled in 2019, but the industry’s tipping point — severing ties to the gas pump — still lies ahead. These cars will help make that happen.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is part of our continuing Fast Forward series, which examines technological, economic, social and cultural shifts that happen as businesses evolve.

articles.headline: Pro-Iranian Protesters End Siege of U.S. Embassy in Baghdad
articles.snippet: Iran’s ability to deploy militias to attack the American Embassy, with Iraqi support, made clear how much power it wields in Iraq.
articles.abstract: Iran’s ability to deploy militias to attack the American Embassy, with Iraqi support, made clear how much power it wields in Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — After a second day of tense protests at the American Embassy in Baghdad, thousands of pro-Iranian demonstrators dispersed on Wednesday, ending a siege that had trapped American diplomats in the embassy compound overnight and winding down a potentially explosive crisis for the Trump administration.
articles.byline: By Falih Hassan and Alissa J. Rubin

articles.headline: The Tech That Will Invade Our Lives in 2020
articles.snippet: From smart homes to ultrafast wireless speeds, here’s what to watch.
articles.abstract: From smart homes to ultrafast wireless speeds, here’s what to watch.
articles.lead_paragraph: The 2010s made one thing clear: Tech is everywhere in life.

articles.headline: Elizabeth Warren Isn’t Talking Much About ‘Medicare for All’ Anymore
articles.snippet: There are signs her campaign is seeking to calm fears about her health care proposal, including having small meetings with rural Iowa voters to explain her financing and transition plans.
articles.abstract: There are signs her campaign is seeking to calm fears about her health care proposal, including having small meetings with rural Iowa voters to explain her financing and transition plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — In warm-up remarks introducing Senator Elizabeth Warren at campaign rallies, young volunteers often say they are supporting her because of her plan to transform the health care system through a single-payer “Medicare for all” program. It happened in Des Moines on Saturday and Oklahoma City last week, and in western Iowa cities like Clarinda and Council Bluffs on Sunday.

articles.headline: In a Homecoming Video Meant to Unite Campus, Almost Everyone Was White
articles.snippet: The video was created to show off the University of Wisconsin. Instead, it set off a furor, and a reckoning over what it means to be a black student on campus.
articles.abstract: The video was created to show off the University of Wisconsin. Instead, it set off a furor, and a reckoning over what it means to be a black student on campus.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Race affects our lives in countless ways. To read more provocative stories on race from The Times, sign up for our Race/Related newsletter here.]

articles.headline: China Moves to Steady Its Slowing Economic Growth
articles.snippet: The country’s central bank will in effect inject $115 billion into the financial system despite signs the economy has been improving.
articles.abstract: The country’s central bank will in effect inject $115 billion into the financial system despite signs the economy has been improving.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China on Wednesday moved to pump more cash into its financial system, suggesting that Beijing remained concerned about faltering growth despite signs that the world’s second-largest economy was stabilizing.
articles.byline: By Carlos Tejada and Ben Casselman
